text: this is lansanah a boy from war-torn
Sierra Leone who had his family
devastated by rebel soldiers and wound
up in a refugee camp with a leg that
needed amputation but a Manhattan dr.
doing outreach at the camp brought
lansanah to New York City for medical
treatment that save his leg the doctor
ions lot lo wound up adopting lon sauna
and moving him into his Greenwich
Village apartment enrolling him in ps3
nearby on sana quickly picked up English
and was exposed to new things like toys
running water television and clean
clothes I was introduced to the doctor
in lansanah by my New York Times
colleague the photographer jim Estrin
who took these pictures of lansanah in
New York in 2003 after a year in New
York City doctors lalo moved lon sauna
to the bay area for a more relaxed
upbringing I got a call this week from
doctors lot lo who said he was back in
New York for a week with lon sauna now a
strapping 16 year old high school
sophomore who loves basketball they were
going around from one pickup basketball

one in Harlem with some former

what I'm 16 now when I was here I was
